item.description:
密歇根大学的 Joanne Hsu 可以看出美国家庭的情绪很低落。有人在听吗？【原文：

item.title: S&P 500 图表观察家担心反弹的领导排名狭窄
item.description: 随着科技股推动美国主要股指屡创新高，技术分析师认为，除非有更多板块加入涨势，否则未来几个月将出现抛售。【原文：With technology stocks powering major US indexes toward record highs, technical analysts see the makings of a selloff in the coming months unless more sectors join the rally.】

item.title: 泰国大麻产业陷入混乱，政府欲将大麻重新定罪
item.description: 泰国在成为亚洲第一个将大麻非刑罪化的国家三年后，准备在政治动荡中改变方向，现在需要有处方才能在 2022 年以来兴起的 10,000 家药房中的任何一家购买大麻。【原文：Three years after becoming the first Asian nation to decriminalize cannabis, Thailand is poised to reverse course amid political turmoil and now requires a prescription to buy cannabis at any of the 10,000 dispensaries that have sprung up since 2022.】

item.title: Thungela 表示，随着安全状况改善，Transnet 煤炭装运量上升
item.description: 据 Thungela Resources Ltd. 称，在解决了运营和安全相关问题后，南非国营物流公司已在该国主要出口铁路线上加大了煤炭交付力度。【原文：South Africa’s state logistics company has ramped up deliveries of coal on the country’s main export rail line after addressing operational and security-related issues, according to Thungela Resources Ltd.】

item.title: 加拿大青年就业市场在主要经济体中下滑幅度最大
item.description: 加拿大年轻人面临的劳动力市场恶化速度比任何其他主要发达经济体都要快。【原文：Young Canadians are facing a labor market that has deteriorated faster than in any other major advanced economy.】

item.title: 投资者摆脱贸易焦虑，亚洲市场全面活跃
item.description: 随着亚洲摆脱关税冲击，并以稳健的增长前景吸引投资者，亚洲各地的交易台再次热闹起来。【原文：Trading desks across Asia are buzzing with excitement again, as the region shakes off tariff shocks and attracts investors with its solid growth prospects.】

item.title: BBVA 在德国开办数字零售银行以促进增长
item.description: 随着西班牙银行在更多欧洲市场推出数字零售银行，BBVA SA 在德国向客户开放了数字零售银行。【原文：BBVA SA has opened its digital retail bank to customers in Germany as the Spanish lender rolls out its offering across more European markets.】

item.title: 克瓦查反弹推动赞比亚通胀率降至 14 个月低点
item.description: 在赞比亚货币反弹帮助抑制了进口成本之后，赞比亚的年度通货膨胀率在 6 月份降至 14 个月以来的最低点。【原文：Zambia’s annual inflation eased to a 14-month low in June after a rally in its currency helped curb the cost of imports.】

item.title: 为什么制造可靠的自动驾驶汽车如此困难？
item.description: 二十年前，美国军方在其具有开创意义的 Darpa 挑战赛中，派出一支刚刚起步的机器人车队穿越莫哈韦沙漠，拉开了制造自动驾驶汽车竞赛的序幕。到 2015 年，自动驾驶汽车技术得到广泛应用，业界盛传无人驾驶汽车很快将无处不在。【原文：Two decades ago, the US military kicked off the race to build self-driving cars by sending a fleet of fledgling robot vehicles across the Mojave Desert in its seminal Darpa challenge. By 2015, autonomous vehicle technology was being widely pursued, and the industry was abuzz with predictions that driverless cars would soon be everywhere.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚利用网上市场促进税收征管
item.description: 随着东南亚最大经济体对财政问题的日益关注，印尼将修改一项规则，要求网商向电子商务平台而不是直接向政府缴纳所得税，从而重振促进税收的努力。【原文：A rule change in Indonesia will require online merchants to pay income tax to e-commerce platforms rather than directly to the government, reviving an effort to boost tax collection as fiscal concerns mount in Southeast Asia’s largest economy.】

item.title: 南非消费者信心在第二季度有所恢复
item.description: 由于取消了增加消费税的提议，联合政府在预算问题上的僵局也告一段落，南非消费者的信心在第二季度有所恢复。【原文：South African consumer confidence recovered in the second quarter as a proposed increase in consumer taxes was scrapped and an impasse in the coalition government over the budget ended.】

item.description:

item.title: 奇货可居：美国公司建造新型超音速喷气机（播客）
item.description: 我们一直在谈论美国试图成为先进制造业的强国，但很多话听起来只是空谈，没有任何实际意义。但有些公司正在努力。Boom Supersonic 是一家成立 11 年的公司，该公司已筹集了数亿美元资金，以制造新型超音速喷气式飞机，供商业航空乘客使用。该公司认为，虽然协和式飞机的商业模式最终没有成功，但没有理由没有市场。【原文：We talk all the time about the US attempting to become a powerhouse in advanced manufacturing, but a lot of it just sounds like talk that’s not going anywhere. But some companies are trying. Boom Supersonic is an 11-year old company that has raised hundreds of millions of dollars in its quest to build a new supersonic jet for commercial air passengers. And it believes that just because the business model of the Concorde didn’t work out in the end, that there’s no reason there can’t be a market f】

item.title: 南非连续 16 年首次实现基本盈余
item.description: 南非实现了 16 年来首次连续的基本预算盈余，表明了其对财政纪律的承诺。【原文：South Africa achieved its first back-to-back primary budget surplus in 16 years, signaling its commitment to fiscal discipline.】

item.title: 韩国启动近四年来首次欧元债券销售
item.description: 韩国政府周四启动了近四年来首次以欧元计价的债券销售，这是在最近李在明当选总统、结束了数月政治动荡之后对投资者胃口的一次考验。【原文：The South Korean government kicked off its first euro-denominated bond sale in nearly four years on Thursday, in a test of investor appetite following the recent election of President Lee Jae Myung that ended months of political turmoil.】

item.title: 中国将放宽尿素出口禁令，缓解全球价格压力
item.description: 中国正在放松对尿素出口的禁令，此举可能会缓解因中东紧张局势而飙升的国际价格。【原文：China is loosening its ban on urea exports, a move likely to ease surging international prices that have been buoyed by tension in the Middle East.】

item.title: 英国乙醇工厂在美国供应浪潮来临前开始收尾工作
item.description: 英国联合食品公司（Associated British Food Plc）的 Vivergo 乙醇厂是英国仅有的两家大型乙醇厂之一，由于美国免税产品的大量涌入，该厂已开始关闭程序，英国的乙醇生产将面临灭顶之灾。【原文：Associated British Food Plc’s Vivergo ethanol plant, one of only two major sites in the nation, has begun closing-down procedures as the flood of US duty-free products looks set to wipe out production in the UK.】

item.title: 菲律宾财政部长表示下调 2025 年 GDP 增长目标
item.description: 由于中东冲突加剧了特朗普政府全球贸易战影响所带来的风险，菲律宾政府下调了今年的经济增长目标。【原文：The Philippine government has cut its economic growth target for this year as the conflict in the Middle East added to risks from the impact of the Trump administration’s global trade war.】

item.title: 马里称国家正在努力恢复巴里克金矿的产出
item.description: 马里表示，一名临时管理者将重新启动巴里克矿业公司（Barrick Mining Corp.【原文：Mali said a temporary administrator will restart production at Barrick Mining Corp.’s Loulo-Gounkoto gold complex, which was put under provisional administration earlier this month.】

item.title: 台湾央行阻止外汇投机者扎堆购买 ETF
item.description: 台湾告诉外国投资者退出通过交易所交易基金对本币的押注，因为本币 12% 的涨幅会威胁到台湾的经济和企业。【原文：Taiwan told foreign investors to exit bets on the local dollar, taken through exchange-traded funds, as a 12% gain in its currency threatens its economy and companies.】

item.title: 全球最大手套生产商看好东南亚供应链安全
item.description: 全球最大的手套生产商Top Glove Corporation Bhd.表示，在美国全球高关税的威胁下，依靠东南亚供应商可以降低风险。【原文：The world’s largest glove maker Top Glove Corporation Bhd. said relying on Southeast Asian suppliers will allay risks amid the threat of high US global tariffs.】

item.title: 便利店零售商 Trolley 计划在科威特进行罕见的首次公开募股
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，科威特便利店 Trolley 正计划首次公开发行股票，这在海湾地区最冷清的新股销售市场中实属罕见。【原文：Kuwaiti convenience store Trolley is planning an initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter, a rare transaction in one of the Gulf’s quietest markets for new share sales.】

item.title: 软银部门计划首次出售 5 亿美元债券
item.description: 软银集团公司（SoftBank Group Corp. ）旗下电信部门计划首次发行美元债券，摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）等公司担任牵头经办人，此次交易旨在筹集约 5 亿美元资金。【原文：SoftBank Group Corp.’s telecommunications unit plans to make its first offering of US dollar-denominated bonds, with Morgan Stanley and others acting as lead managers, in a deal aiming to raise about $500 million.】

item.title: 中国科技企业在北京的支持下加强并购交易
item.description: 中国的科技巨头们在经历了一场令其身价缩水数十亿美元、迫使高层管理人员退出公众视线的严厉打击之后，又重新受到青睐，开始大肆进行交易和资产收购。【原文：After a chastening crackdown that wiped billions off their value and forced top executives out of the public eye, China’s technology giants are back in favor and on the front foot, making deals and snapping up assets.】

item.title: 市长称英国工党需要遏制非英国籍人士外流
item.description: 伦敦金融城市长阿拉斯泰尔-金（Alastair King）表示，英国政府应采取行动，阻止外国富豪在英国实施大规模税收打击后外逃。【原文：The UK government should act to stem an exodus of wealthy foreigners from the country following a major tax crackdown, said Alastair King, Lord Mayor of the City of London.】

item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，专注于视觉感知的中国人工智能公司Reconova Technologies Co.【原文：Reconova Technologies Co., a Chinese artificial intelligence company specializing in visual perception, is planning a Hong Kong initial public offering as soon as this year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Kpler 数据显示中国液化天然气进口量将连续第八个月下降
item.description: 克普勒公司（Kpler）的数据显示，由于管道天然气和国产天然气供应保持强劲，中国液化天然气进口量将连续第八个月同比下降。【原文：China’s imports of liquefied natural gas are poised to decline for an eighth month on a year-on-year basis, according to data from Kpler, as piped and domestically produced supply remain robust.】

item.title: 格陵兰矿商在特朗普提振兴趣后寻求与美国和欧盟达成协议
item.description: 格陵兰岛最大的矿业公司阿玛鲁克矿业有限公司（Amaroq Minerals Ltd）首席执行官说，随着唐纳德-特朗普的政治聚光灯转化为投资者的具体兴趣，该公司正在与几个国家支持的机构进行谈判。【原文：Greenland’s biggest miner Amaroq Minerals Ltd is in talks with several state-backed agencies as Donald Trump’s political spotlight translates into concrete investor interest, the company’s chief executive officer said.】
